title: Player penalties are immoral and completely unfair
body:
Good afternoon everyone,

1st of all this is long. I don't frequent the forums at all, but I am sure many of these type posts have been made. Some good , some bad. Currently, I am suspended for 14 games. I previously have had 2 accounts perma banned that I spent a decent amount of money on. Below I have quoted the exact text that got me suspended with comments. I may be an ass sometimes, but never have I ever said hate speech(racist, homophobic, ect). Never have I said someone should walk into traffic or kill themselves, which many have said to me. I curse and I get frustrated, but I always pertain it to the game. 

I find it sickening at what is considered "toxic" in this game. Never-mind the person that will not speak in champ select and troll picks, or goes 0-7 in the first 10 min. The person that goes afk 3 times in a match but always comes back just in time to avoid penalty. Let's not even bring up how bad it was before people got to choose their role. Never-mind the people the ACTUALLY ruin games. They can do that all they want, with 0 penalty. But, don't you dare say a word about it. And don't you dare tell someone they suck because they are ruining a game or feeding. What's worse is that I was suspended less that 5 min after a game. Who is reviewing this? A pre-made of 4 could troll and just report people and get accounts people spent money on banned? That isn't right.

When  I started this game, Shen was the new champ. Not sure how close to beta that was. Not once have I ever seen Riot make a point to separate Ranked from Normal. Ranked is supposed to be competitive, Look at any competitive sport in the world, and tell me emotions don't run high. I'm sorry, but if can't handle few curse words then GTFO and play normal. It's horrible that Riot still caters to this passive aggressive bullshit and in effect steals, yes STEALS, money from people over it. Riot, haven't you make your Gazillions already? Can't you actually make ranked a skill based competition? Stop catering to these children so you can make an extra buck and rob the real players out there. 

And no, going through support isn't the best route. I tried that multiple times and all you get is a copy and paste bullshit suit and tie answer. NOTHING I said deserves a suspension. Anyways, as I said, here is the game chat logs that got me suspended this time. Judge for yourself if should be able to play for 2 weeks:

replies.body:
Okay, several things.

1. Any amount of time gone from the game counts towards the leavebuster penalty, and the system is more intelligent than you think. Merely coming back and wiggling a little bit doesn't stop the system from detecting you. Just because they didn't get punished this one time doesn't mean that they would never get punished. It's much more likely that they haven't built up enough afk/dc time for it to flag them.

2. That pre-made of 4 trolling a person still relies on you snapping and venting your anger in chat. **_It's still completely in your control to avoid getting banned_**. You're in control of your own actions in chat. And people _do_ get banned for trolling, it just doesn't happen as often since the system want to make sure that it never bans someone for simply playing really bad **unintentionally**. Report them if they troll, don't bother bringing it to chat since it's not going to help.

3. If you can't handle being civil in chat then Riot will tell you to GTFO. Yes, I know you want to vent your anger on other players, but this is not allowed. Yell at your screen or something instead.

4. Riot is not stealing from you. Your account is not yours, it's Riot's. They agree to let you continue using it so long as you continue to abide by their rules. This is the case for all online games.

1- BULLLLLLLLSHIT- keep believe what is shoved down your throat.

2- Wrong. IF a premade of decided they would report any 5th they play with, then that completely eliminates your arguement(Trolls happen)

3- I've been called a"kid" already 3 or 4 times in this thread, yet I'm the problem.

4- That is horseshit, a legal technicality.

> [{quoted}](name=BlindPizzaGuy,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=lUzecPNz,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-09-24T17:08:00.686+0000)
>
> 1- BULLLLLLLLSHIT- keep believe what is shoved down your throat.

From the [Leaverbuster FAQ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ#h1q1): 

>**WHAT IS LEAVERBUSTER?**
LeaverBuster is a system we have implemented in order to discourage Summoners from repeatedly leaving matches and/or idling during gameplay. Summoners who exhibit this behavior **and have a trend of leaving/idling in games** will be placed in a low priority queue

Emphasis mine.
 
> 2- Wrong. IF a premade of decided they would report any 5th they play with, then that completely eliminates your arguement(Trolls happen)

Yes trolls happen, but the system is designed so that a pre-made group can't report you and instantly get you punished on the spot. From [Riot Tantram](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/unobngtr-how-player-behavior-penalties-affect-hextech-crafting?show=rundown): 

>Actually, Erdrik is correct here.

>A report flags a game for review. They do not establish guilt. The game is then reviewed for harassment, feeding, etc. This is why 'troll reporting' or 'gang reporting' do not work. False or inaccurate reports are thrown out.

>You cannot ever be punished for saying nothing .. unless of course it's for something gameplay related like feeding, afking or cheating. But, you can never be punished for offensive language, hate speech or verbal abuse if you said nothing.

Simply put if you know that you've done nothing wrong then you don't have to worry about being punished for something that you didn't do in that game. On the flip-side though if you know that you've been acting up in that game and a pre-made decides to report you for it then you will be punished solely because of your actions alone in that game rather than because of the pre-made reporting you.
 
> 3- I've been called a"kid" already 3 or 4 times in this thread, yet I'm the problem.

If someone else has a harassment filled post then report it. Don't add onto the negativity by becoming negative yourself. Just like in-game retaliation is not okay on the forums, and if you retaliate then you both get punished period.
 
> 4- That is horseshit, a legal technicality.

This is Riot's house and Riot's rules. If you refuse to follow their rules then they reserve the right to kick you out of their house. It's the same with any other gaming company where if you don't or won't follow their rules then they can just kick you out of their game because of it. Be thankful that Riot even gives people the chance to try to Reform first rather than just immediately booting them from the game outright like most other companies do.

P.S. [Here are](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/sU5wOfFJ-proof-that-the-automated-system-is-broken?show=rundown) two examples of gameplay trolls being banned. Yes it's just two examples, but it proves that they do get punished.

> 
> P.S. [Here are](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/sU5wOfFJ-proof-that-the-automated-system-is-broken?show=rundown) two examples of gameplay trolls being banned. Yes it's just two examples, but it proves that they do get punished.

Sigh.....Please you some intuition. The email given to you by Riot when they notify you TELLS you which games you were reported on. The player even  notes this. The Rioter said that HE didn't didn't mention certain games, which is irrelevant.

"Never-mind the people the ACTUALLY ruin games. They can do that all they want, with 0 penalty."

They get penalized, you just don't see it because it isn't happening to you. Riot doesn't send you a message every time they punish someone else, just when you do.

---
"Never-mind the person that will not speak in champ select and troll picks, or goes 0-7 in the first 10 min."

Maybe they are just bad? Losing your lane against a much more skilled opponent isn't against the rules.

---
"The person that goes afk 3 times in a match but always comes back just in time to avoid penalty."

They will get punished if they are reported for it a few times. Most people don't report for that though for whatever reason.

---
"But, don't you dare say a word about it. And don't you dare tell someone they suck because they are ruining a game or feeding."

Well, harassing people is against the rules. So yeah, don't do that. You can recommend a better way of doing things in a positive way, but the way you just described it is just harassment.

---
"What's worse is that I was suspended less that 5 min after a game. Who is reviewing this?"

An automated system that reviews games based on past detailed reports that tell what people do and don't consider toxic, within reason. Riot doesn't explain exactly how it works for security reasons, but I would imagine that riot employees gather info based on what people say in the reports, then update the system to look for it.

---
"A pre-made of 4 could troll and just report people and get accounts people spent money on banned? That isn't right."

It counts games you were reported in, not how many times you were reported. So like, 20 reports across 5 games is five games you were reported in, not twenty times you were reported. Also if they are falsely reporting you then their report weight will drop and their reports will mean less to the system.

---
"Look at any competitive sport in the world, and tell me emotions don't run high."

Emotions definitely run high, that is why they have rules and ways to enforce them in those too. http://operations.nfl.com/football-ops/fines-appeals/

That is a link to the NFL's page for fines and appeals against them. Scroll down to the sportsmanship section. Taunting your opponent is a $9,000 fine minimum, excessive profanity is $12,000.

---
"I'm sorry, but if can't handle few curse words then GTFO and play normal."

You aren't being banned because we are offended or cant handle curse words. I have used them before in game and otherwise and never been punished. You are being banned because nobody wants to play with you, and riot feels you are a big enough detriment and lack commitment to reforming from your behavior in any aspect that they want you to take your business elsewhere.

---
"It's horrible that Riot still caters to this passive aggressive bullshit and in effect steals, yes STEALS, money from people over it."

Read the terms of service you agreed to. You agreed that you could be banned with no reimbursement. You also agreed that you could be banned if, according to section 2.1.2 subsection (c), "doing so would be in the best interests of our community, the Riot Services, or the rights of a third party." I am not speaking for Riot games 100%, but if I had to guess in court they would go with that one.

---
"Stop catering to these children so you can make an extra buck and rob the real players out there."

The only reason they are making any extra money off of you is because you come back and give it to them. Why not just go skinless?

---
"And no, going through support isn't the best route. I tried that multiple times and all you get is a copy and paste bullshit suit and tie answer."

I bet that "copy and paste bullshit" covered your question in full if you took the time to read it without being upset that they aren't just unbanning you. I could be wrong, people have made mistakes and misclicked the copy button before.

---
Sorry if this seems conceited, I do not usually pick apart posts like this. There were just so many different topics that I wanted to discuss that I had to separate them. Really I have seen posts about all of these individually but never so many together like this XD 

If I go on and talk too much about your chat logs this post will be really long, but basically you aren't overly offensive from a racist stand point or anything, you are just consistently negative and you feel the need to harshly criticize everything you see. It isn't your job and it is really annoying and tilting. If you said everything you said in a more positive and constructive way, like giving a solution instead of just the problem, then you would probably never even be reported.

Good luck in the future if you continue to play, and keep in mind that your next punishment will be a permanent ban on this account unless you go a considerable length of time showing signs of reforming. That will lower your tier of punishment.

Zezo, I do not disagree with you on many of these, but overall I strongly still just do not feel that my actions warrant the penalty that I received. Another example of this would be not receiving rewards after completing the chat restriction games.  I do disagree when you say no one wants to play with me, I have a group of people that I play with regularly and we lose game all the time. I never get angry with them because they aren't trolling or feeding.   

I also still feel that the real issues of the community are not being dealt with properly. It is a fact as I said before this game is WIDELY considered to have the worst community in gaming, and I blames this exclusively on the player report system and how it works, and the lack of banning trolls over trash talkers.

It is a fact as I said before this game is WIDELY considered to have the worst community in gaming, and I blames this exclusively on the player report system and how it works, and the lack of banning trolls over trash talkers.

The punishment system works in tiers. Before your 2 week ban you should have gotten a 10 game chat restriction, and then a 25 game chat restriction. It isn't usually based on severity unless it is very severe, which will skip you tiers. Basically you are being punished for consistency, you type too much and too harshly on too many things.

Riot has been pretty transparent about the loot rewards being a reward for good gameplay AND good behavior since the start, not Lyte levels of transparent but the info has been out there.

I didn't literally mean nobody wants to play with you, I played the comment up a bit to try to show the dramatic difference between what you think Riot thinks is wrong with your behavior and what they actually think is wrong. Of course there are people out there who will play with you, you don't seem like a bad person to people who you know and can have extended discussions with. Your issue is interacting with the various people you haven't been able to establish a connection with. You don't know them so you fill in the gaps with assumptions that they are bad. Then every time something bad happens you tell them without offering a solution. This makes the other person feel trapped and nervous, which makes them lose concentration and play worse, which further decreases your opinion of them. This cycles out of control until you lose the game and assume that because their score is bad that they were intentionally feeding or just not listening to you.

The reason why league is considered so toxic is because of a few reasons. It was the first really really massive game that required good communication and large time investments to play, along with being slow paced enough to make chat a big deal.
